Title: Highlight Query Results Map-Reduce
DescriptionLines: **A Map-Reduce Index can aggregate text content** as well.
Similar to a Map Index, a Full Text Search query requesting Highlights can be made against such aggregated text field.
So in addition to getting the matching Map-Reduce index-entries in the query results,
you can **get a list of text fragments highlighting the searched terms** in the aggregated text field.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define the Map-Reduce index class
DescriptionLines: * Create a static Map-Reduce index class - inherit from `AbstractIndexCreationTask`.

Assets.Title: Map-Reduce indexes via client code - Book

Walkthroughs.Title: The Index Entry class
DescriptionLines: * The IndexEntry class defines the _index-fields per entry_ in the index.
These fields will be indexed and can be queried on.
* In this example, each resulting _index-entry_ will have the above 2 index-fields:
* Artist - will be the Key field to group by
* AllSongTitles - will be the aggregated text field
* The content for each index-field is configured in the index constructor (see next step).

Assets.Title: Map-Reduce indexes via client code - Book

Walkthroughs.Title: Define the Map function
DescriptionLines: * Similar to the simple Map-index, the `map` function defines what data is indexed per index-field.
* The Map function is the first stage of the Map-Reduce index.
It indexes the specified fields _per document_ in the collection.
* _Artist_ - per document, this field will contain the artist's name.
This field will be the Key field, by which to group-by.
* _AllSongTitles_ - per document, will contain the document's Title field.

This field will be aggregated in the following Reduce stage,
accumulating all the song titles of an artist.
* The fields will be customized for Full Text Search and Highlighting in step 5.

Assets.Title: Map-Reduce indexes via client code - Book

Walkthroughs.Title: Define the Reduce function
DescriptionLines: * The `reduce` function is the second stage.
It operates on the Map results, specifying how the data should be _grouped_ and _aggregated_.
* Specify the field to group-by:
`GroupBy(result => result.Artist)`  ==> group by index-field 'Artist'
* Specify the aggregation needed for that field:
`Artist = g.Key`
==> The artist we group by
`AllSongTitles = String.Join(" ", g.Select(x => x.AllSongTitles))`
==> using String.Join() to concatenate the text, as the aggregation function.

Assets.Title: Map-Reduce indexes via client code - Book

Walkthroughs.Title: Configure fields for Highlighting
DescriptionLines:
* In order to search and get fragments with highlighted terms,
the index-fields must be configured with:
* `store()`
Set _FieldStorage.YES_ on both the _Key field_ and the _Aggregated field_.
* `index()`
Set _FieldIndexing.SEARCH_ on the aggregated field.
* `termVector()`
Set _FieldTermVector.WITH_POSITIONS_AND_OFFSETS_ on the aggregated field.
* During the indexing process, the aggregated field's content is tokenized, broken into distinct terms according to the configured analyzer (RavenStandardAnalyzer is used by default).
* A query can now be made on these terms to get their matching index-entries - including a list of text fragments containing the highlighted searched terms.
See next step.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define highlight options
DescriptionLines:
* Prior to making the search query,
you must define a `HighlightingOptions` object with a `GroupKey`.
* Assign the Key index-field name (the one you group-by) to GroupKey, e.g. 'Artist'.
* Optionally, you can also define `PreTags` and `PostTags` that will mark the searched terms within the text fragments.
If no such tags are defined then the default tags will be used.
See the related Highlights Demos.
* This object will be passed to the query - see next step.

Walkthroughs.Title: Make a search query
DescriptionLines: * A query can now be made on the Map-Reduce index-entries.

* In this example,
we are searching for artists containing the searched term within their 'AllSongTitles' field.
In addition, we request the highlighted fragments.
* `highlight()`
* Specify the index-field for which to get text fragments with the term highlighted.
* fragmentLength - the maximum length for a fragment (length must be >= 18).
* fragmentCount - used to limit the number of matching fragments returned per document.
* Provide 'Highlightings' param (highlightingsInfo) for the fragments' results.
* `search()`
* Specify the index-field and the term(s) to search for in that field.
* These will be the terms highlighted in the fragments received.
* _Query results will be_:
* artistsResults -
_The index-entries_ that contain the searched term in their 'AllSongTitles' field.
* highlightingsInfo -
_The fragments_ from the aggregated field 'AllSongTitles' that contain the searched term.
The term will be marked with the customized pre & post tags.

Assets.Title: Query for aggregated value - Map-Reduce Index Demo

Walkthroughs.Title: Get fragments
DescriptionLines:
* Use `getFragments()`
Pass a Key field value (Artist) to get the text fragments from its matching index-entry.
* The searched term will be marked with the customized pre & post tags.
* Use these results to enhance your users' search experience.
